fullContent: Gurmeet Chadha suggests a phased investment strategy amid market volatility. He advises allocating 25-30% of funds now, with the remainder deployed gradually. Chadha highlights opportunities in quality banks like ICICI Bank and Federal Bank. He also sees potential in NBFCs and power equipment companies. Long duration bonds and gold are attractive options for investors.

fullContent: Sandip Agarwal notes the Indian investor's increasing maturity, moving beyond panic selling to strategic buying after initial market dips. Investors are keenly awaiting SBI's results and future strategies for deploying raised funds.

title: The Hottest New Credit Deals in Europe Are Anything to Do With Defense

title: Trump’s Surprise Fed Pick Buys Him Time on Chair Selection

title: UK Resets Ties With Zimbabwe in Push for Critical Minerals
